actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 845.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table. Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to table the measure Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 208
actions-list.actionItem: 213, 1 Present (Roll no. 608).
Ms. Clark (MA) moved to table the measure.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 845 — "Censuring Representative Rashida Tlaib for promoting false narratives regarding the October 7, 2023, Hamas attack on Israel and for calling for the destruction of the state of Israel."

actions-list.header: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. McCormick rose to a question of the privileges of the House and offered the resolution. The Chair directed the Clerk to report the resolution. Upon examination of the resolution, the Chair determined that the resolution did constitute a question of the privileges of the House.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 4820 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cole moved that the committee rise.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Brecheen amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 174
On agreeing to the Grothman amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 213
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 148
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 125
On agreeing to the Escobar amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 212

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to amendments to H.R. 4820, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4820 — "Making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 217
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 847 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4664) making appropriations for financial services and general government for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 847, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Leger Fernandez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 847.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 847 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4664) making appropriations for financial services and general government for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Harder of CA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 7.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dale W. Strong to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
